bibl.title: Despatch from John H. Smyth to John Hay
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

div1.p:
Consulate General of the United States,
Monrovia, La, Jan'y 27, 1881.
Mr. J. H. Smyth to the Assis't Sec'y of State.

Consulate General of the United States,
Monrovia, La, Jan'y 27, 1881.

I take pleasure in acknowledging the receipt of package containing copies of 'Regulations for Preventing Collisions at Sea', &c, &c, which are sufficient for my present use. Also, I received eight copies of 'Commercial Relations of the United States', No 1, Oct. 1880, copies of the President's Message, and pamphlet entitled 'Gold Standard'; for all of which be pleased to accept my thanks.

I am, Sir, Your obd't serv't,
Jno. H. Smyth, U.S. Consul Gen'l.
div1.fw:
Hon. John Hay,
Assistant Secretary,
Washington, D.C.
